Projects
Swap-E
menu

How might we make profit out of used electronic products to both buyers and sellers

with Kanchan Kumar, Imran Khan & Girish Rao

Explore
Overview

Swap-E was my final main project during my UX certification at UX Mint Design and Research Academy. The topics were assigned by the mentor to each team and our team were given this problem to solve. Theory classes of the each steps in the human centred design approach were taught and simulatenously we implemented the theoritical learning into our project. As a result, we were able to dip our hands into many important concepts in design thinking approach.

Duration Mar 2018 - Jun 2018 (4 Months)
Domain E Commerce Sector
Done as Design Academy Final Project
My Role “My roles include preparing questionnaire and transcipting the voice recorded interviews during research phase. I was involved in ideation, brainstorming and prototyping the entire project. Also I designed the UI components and documented the entire project”
UX Mint Chennai Jan 2018 Batch
7 Days
Key Points from
The Background Study

Every people in their home or workplace would have kept some unused electrical or electronic products knowingly or unknowingly for a long time. While cleaning or organizing your place, that unused e-product might be thrown at garbage which affects the environment badly. People should be aware that those totally unusable e-products will also have some value

"Out of Sight is out of mind”

According to recent studies, almost 2.7 million tons of electronic waste are being generated annually in India.

Primary Sources are Retailer, individuals, and Tech Companies which have many used e-products

Recent survey concluded that 26% of the population are still unaware of the problems caused by e-wastes

Problem Solving
Approach
3 Days
Things we did in
Stakeholder Research

Telephonic Interview was conducted with the stakeholder to understand the reuqirements about the project. Laddering Technique is followed during the interview to gather all the basic details required.

1. Vision

One stop portal for selling e-waste, e-products and buying the recycled or refurbished products for an affordable & genuine price like Richie Street.

2. Project Brief

Collection of e-waste / e-product — Quality Check — Seggregation — Recycle or Refurbish - Categorization - Selling e products

3. Primary Objective

E-waste collection & Recycling. Buying & selling electronic products that are in both working and null condition to the user

4. Secondary Objective

Assured Price on the go for sellers. Quick and easy process for selling both e-waste and e-products. Similarity and easy to earch what they want.

5. Problem Statement

Increase in electrical & electronic goods usage and reduction in disposal. Lack of awareness in disposal of old e-products

6. Existing Drawbacks

They work as a mediator in buying and selling e-products without any proper segregation of useful product and waste products

21 Days
Findings From
The User Research

Qualitative Data Gathering was conducted individually among different users in real-time. The gathered data is grouped primarily based on their personality traits. We interviewed around 25 people and drilled down to 5 persona. Following is one of the persona that we have encountered during our research

6 Days
Mapping Out
The Journey Map

Calculative Person's journey was tracked and defined the various emotions he felt through the process of selling

7 Days
Digging Out
The Root Cause

Various pain points are taken and root cause is found out. One such example is show below

7 Days
Ideating the
The Conceptual Model

After finding major problems in Root Cause Analysis, Conceptual Model is done by addressing key problems that we have found out.

3 Days
Prioritizing
The Task

After listing down the task from the conceptual model, Task Prioritization is performed using Eisenhower Matrix

10 Days
Structuring
The Information Architecture

Closed Card Sorting is performed for the list of task and information architecture is drawn for the task. Hierarchial Navigation Model is followed for the buying flow and Reciprocation Navigation Model is followed for the selling flow

20 Days
Connecting
The Page Flow
4 Days
Setting up
The UI Foundation
21 Days
Designing
The Interface

Rat and Cheese concept was followed by allowing the user to taste the essence of the product but should get onboarded to enjoy the complete product.

Onboarding should be quick and simple and also should be informative

Sign In with your credential if you are an existing user

New User? Create you account in three simple steps

Lazy and not willing to share your personal details , choose your location and explore

Home Screen

Fitt's Law is followed in placing each task based on their priority such that it will provide quick and easy access

App Bar

The Brand logo is kept at the top left as the human eye usually tends to perceive from top left (Serial Position Effect). Profile falls into high importance but low-frequency category, it is kept at the right top of the product

Category Carousel

Since each user comes with a different expectation of products, they are categorized to identify what they are looking for at the first glance. Pictures are used for categories which provide clear information than illustration. On scrolling down, categories are kept fixed at the top

The Product Feed

Law of Common Region is followed for the product card. Each information of the product is visually arranged based on their importance

Bottom Navigation Bar

Von Restorff Effect (Isolation Effect) is achieved by isolating Sell Option since it is one of the high prioritized task in our conceptual model.

Selling Flow

Classified E-Products into two types based on the quantity and working condition. This helps the user to understand the difference between the usable and non-usable e-products.

Selling Details

Give clear information on how selling a product will work

Educate the User on how to shoot a perfect video of their product

Provide summary of what values they have chosen in the process

Choose the waste type and specify the count to get the estimate

Selling Options

For the people who are messed up with lot of products/lazy to travel, find a hop that comes to the user's place. If no hops come to your place, find a nearby selling point, book an appointment and sell on the go.

Buying Categorization

A brand is one of primary categorization that most people prefer towards mobile phones. Filters are defined based on their requirement for a used product

Product Grouping

The same item with varying condition and price are grouped. This allow them to compare products and take the required decision. Product Info Screen highlights the key feature. Product Condition is also cleared defined which helps people in taking a decision.

Looking back at
The Reflections
Importance of Human-Centred Design Approach

Learnt the process from discovery to evaluation in detail. Understood the importance of user research which was very critical when the project moved into the ideation phase and evaluation phase

Design System Concept

Learnt the concept of Atomic System suggested by Brad Frost which was helpful in completing the UI Design with consistency in a limited time frame

Brainstorming Session

The brainstorming session followed during this project was very unique since I was involved more in a lateral way thinking and then converting those thinking into a feasible solution.

Overall the course I did in this academy was a life-changing experience for me in terms of design thinking and way of approaching a problem in realtime

In Future
The Augmented-Reality

The same item with varying condition and price are grouped. Allows them to compare products and take the required decision. Product Info Screen highlights the key feature. Product Condition is also cleared defined which helps people in taking a decision
